snippet: After a courtroom appearance by a man who defense lawyers say is the person who shot Ennis Cosby to death in January 1997, the prosecution abruptly rested its case today.    The man, Eli Zakaria, was escorted by sheriff's deputies into the courtro...
lead_paragraph: After a courtroom appearance by a man who defense lawyers say is the person who shot Ennis Cosby to death in January 1997, the prosecution abruptly rested its case today. The man, Eli Zakaria, was escorted by sheriff's deputies into the courtroom in handcuffs and a jail jumpsuit. Mr. Zakaria said nothing but was told to stand only inches from the jury. He was then taken out of the courtroom.
abstract: Prosecution abruptly rests in trial of Mikail Markhasev, charged with Jan 1997 California murder of Ennis Cosby (S)0

headline.main: National News Briefs; Prosecutor Abruptly Ends Her Case in Cosby Killing
